metadata.title: Speaking with the Drunk Miner
metadata.description: Conversation with Old Silas who worked in the mine

start.speaker: Old Silas
start.text: *hic* Another drink... another drink to forget those caves...

choices.text: Let me buy you a drink.
What do you know about the caves?
Was there really marble in the cave?

grateful.speaker: Old Silas
grateful.text: Bless you, stranger. *hic* You're the first kind soul I've met in weeks. What do you want to know? I'll tell you anything.

choices.text: Was there marble in that cave?
Did you ever meet a man named Cornelius Buckley?

caves_memory.speaker: Old Silas
caves_memory.text: The caves? Dark as a widow's heart, they are. We dug for guano — bat droppings — sold it for gunpowder. Nasty work.

caves_detailed.speaker: Old Silas
caves_detailed.text: I worked those caves for five years. Every tunnel, every chamber. The Cathedral Room, the Spring Room, all of it. Until they threw us out.

mining_company.speaker: Old Silas
mining_company.text: The Marble Cave Mining Company. Ha! They called it marble to sell shares to Eastern investors. But we never dug up no marble. Just guano and limestone.

marble_truth.speaker: Old Silas
marble_truth.text: *hic* Marble? Hahahaha! That's a good one. Never was no marble. Just limestone. Pretty limestone, mind you, but limestone all the same.

marble_detailed.speaker: Old Silas
marble_detailed.text: The company founders knew there was no marble. They hired a geologist from St. Louis to fake the assay reports. Made a fortune selling worthless shares.

original_fraud.speaker: Old Silas
original_fraud.text: When the investors came to see their 'marble quarry,' the company was already bankrupt. The founders had fled to California with all the money.

knows_cornelius.speaker: Old Silas
knows_cornelius.text: Cornelius? The fellow with all the questions? He bought me drinks too. Asked about the old days, the mining company, the Spanish explorers...

cornelius_discovery.speaker: Old Silas
cornelius_discovery.text: He was excited about something. Said he'd found proof of an old land grant — something about separated mineral rights. Said it would 'change everything.'

cornelius_warning.speaker: Old Silas
cornelius_warning.text: Then he went into the caves one day and never came back. Some say he got lost. Some say... something found him.
